text: Spearmint is a type of mint. It is also called garden mint, common mint, lamb mint and mackerel mint. It is native to Europe and southern Asia. It is naturalized in northern and southern Africa, North America and South America. It is used as a flavouring in food and herbal teas. The species and subspecies have many synonyms. == References == Category:Herbs Category:Oils Category:Plants of Asia Category:Lamiaceae
title: Spearmint
